Field Detail

namedArguments

java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> namedArguments
Constructor Detail

ArgumentParser

public ArgumentParser(java.lang.String[] args)
An ArgumentParser very simply interprets command line arguments as a sequence of names (which begin with hyphens) and values associated with those names (which don't). The constructor is designed to be portable from project to project. It simply turns the array of strings into a HashMap. The getter and setter methods that follow are project-specific.

Parameters:
args - Arguments sent from the main class.
Method Detail

getString

public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)

isPresent

public boolean isPresent(java.lang.String key)
This method checks simply whether a string was included as a name in the arguments. This allows it both to check for the presence of a named parameter and for a naked name used as a flag. (I.e., set equal to "true.")

Parameters:
key - String that must have been present as a name in the args.
Returns:
Boolean value indicating whether the name was present.

public int getInteger(java.lang.String key)
